Here's hoping for the demise of all right-wingers. Religion must go as 
well. America could truly be the 'land of the free' if it wasn't for 
Bible-thumping conservative pieces of trash controlling it/seeking to 
control it. I honestly consider myself exceptionally lucky to have not been 
born in the US. I'd have quickly gone utterly insane if surrounded by so 
many conservative nutcases. My sympathies and best wishes to all left-wing,

comments.text:
Until the Southern Strategy employed by Nixon to draw conservative 
southerners into the Republican Party.  It's no coincidence that the 
industrial North was progressive, abolitionist, and Republican during the 
Civil War and the south was conservative, racist, and Democrat.  Now that 
demographic has changed to the direct opposite: the north and urban areas 
are liberal and vote Democrat (since it's at least closer to our ideal but 
far from what we really want) and the south is now conservative and 
Republican.  You know very well that in many ways, the parties switched 
platforms and that the racist "Dixiecrats" have nothing to do with the 
modern Democrat party.  Proof?  Look at footage from the last Republican 
National Convention and count how many people from non-white ethnicities 
are in attendance and then compare that to the Democratic Convention.  In 
fact, one of the few black people at the Republican Convention, a reporter, 
was verbally assaulted with racial epithets by conservative attendees.  It 
was just a case of conservatives showing their true colors.
comments.author: synapse131

comments.text:
+Frank M I'm sorry but a lot of that is simply not true..Because areas like 
Chicago, New York, Detroit, L.A, D.C teachers there are paid well and 
unionized with high tax rates. Making well over 70k in Chicago and the 
schooling is horrible..Half the kids can't even graduate high school, tons 
of kids end up joining gangs and involved with drugs. Detroit almost 40-50% 
of kids can barley read. When tax rates are lower the state actually get's 
more money overall. More people have money willing to spend it. Attracts 
more people to live in your state. Florida and Texas are perfect examples. 
Residents do not have to pay any state taxes. As a result plenty of wealthy 
rich people have been moving here for this very reason. They choose to move 
here and invest their money in the state. This is also the same reason why 
plenty of people have been moving out of NY and Cali. Rich people do not 
want to see 60% of their earnings go to the government just to get wasted. 
First rule of business when your expenses goes up you need to cut 
cost...Often it is raising prices, cut employee wages and benefits, cut 
full time employee's, lay off unnecessary workers. Now when businesses have 
more money is more money to invest and spend..Open up more stores which 
creates jobs, cut prices to attract more customers and be more competitive, 
able to give workers full time hours, pay raises. Whenever taxes goes up 
companies will always have to make cuts to make up loss revenue.
comments.author: AlexS71192

comments.text:
+AlexS71192 A state with low unemployment means there are only a handful of 
people looking for jobs. North Dakota is mostly farmland, so naturally 
people are going to be farmers or on welfare and most won't be looking for 
jobs. I live in Missouri and moved to the south for one year. When I saw 
everything was worse than here especially pay with jobs, I moved back to 
Missouri. Lower taxes means lower paying jobs. The reason why the jobs pay 
low is because those are usually right to work states with little or no 
unions in the area to boost pay for everyone. The other reason why those 
jobs pay well is the education in those states is poor. When you can't 
afford good teachers due to the lack of taxes, then you don't get good 
schools.

comments.text:

When taxes are low everyine has more money to spend and invest into jobs

always cuts into their profit margins. They need a certain percentage of 
profits to stay afloat. To make up for these loss of profits they cut 
hours, hire less, raise prices, cut benefits, lower wages. etc.
comments.author: AlexS71192

comments.text:

comments.author: HitomiAyumu

comments.text:
+AlexS71192 Yeah, have you ever lived in a state that has no income tax? 
Then afterwards seen how much better it is in states that do have their 
citizens pay taxes? Low or no taxes hurts schools, emergency services, 
hospitals, road crews, police, farmers, water systems, and all other forms 
of public services. These are the things that the people need to maintain a 
quality lifestyle. This is why Republicans lower taxes to take that stuff 
away from the 99%. You also say unemployment is low in 16 out of 20 
republican states. Those states are probably also right to work states as 
well. Unemployment is low in those states, because welfare pays better than 
the average job. Why would you look for a job when you can't do better than 
$10/hr? Since the taxes are little to nothing, school districts can't 
afford to hire good teachers. This creates bad schools with a less 
intelligent populous which creates no demand for good paying, skilled jobs. 
Since those states have no taxes they cant use tax incentives to lure those 
businesses either. The republican states don't really want to cut spending. 
They have to, because all the welfare recipients cause those states to be 
net loss to the taxpayers. They are in a downward spiral that can't be 
stopped, and the rest of the country is being drug down with them. You also 
mentioned the deficit. That will always go up. The number doesn't matter. 
What matters is how much is being spent in relation to the size of our 
economy. When you look at how much smaller the economy was under Bush, he 
spent much more than Obama even though amount is less.
comments.author: Frank M
